titles.title: A bill to require each agency, in providing notice of a rule making, to include a link to a 100 word plain language summary of the proposed rule.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

calendar.text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. Reported by Senator Johnson without amendment. With written report No. 116-14.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 45.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Antitrust, Commercial, and Administrative Law.

committee.name: Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

bill.summary:
Providing Accountability Through Transparency Act of 2019
This bill requires the notice of a proposed rule by a federal agency to include the Internet address of a summary of the rule. The summary must be 100 words or fewer, written in plain language, and posted on regulations.gov.
